verses.verse: Better<WH2896> is a dry<WH2720> morsel<WH6595> with quietness,<WH7962> than a house<WH1004> full<WH4392> of feasting<WH2077> with strife.<WH7379>
A servant<WH5650> who deals wisely<WH7919> will rule<WH4910> over a son<WH1121> who causes shame,<WH954> and shall have a part<WH2505> in the inheritance<WH5159> among<WH8432> the brothers.<WH251>
The refining pot<WH4715> is for silver,<WH3701> and the furnace<WH3564> for gold,<WH2091> but Yahweh<WH3068> tests<WH974> the hearts.<WH3826>
An evildoer<WH7489> heeds<WH7181> wicked<WH205> lips.<WH8193> A liar<WH8267> gives ear<WH238> to a mischievous<WH1942> tongue.<WH3956>
Whoever mocks<WH3932> the poor<WH7326> reproaches<WH2778> his Maker.<WH6213> He who is glad<WH8056> at calamity<WH343> shall not be unpunished.<WH5352>
Children<WH1121>'s children<WH1121> are the crown<WH5850> of old men;<WH2205> the glory<WH8597> of children<WH1121> are their parents.<WH1>
Arrogant<WH3499> speech<WH8193> isn't<WH5000> fitting for a fool,<WH5036> much less do lying<WH8267> lips<WH8193> fit a prince.<WH5081>
A bribe<WH7810> is a precious<WH2580> stone<WH68> in the eyes<WH5869> of him who gives<WH1167> it;<WH6437> wherever he turns, he prospers.<WH7919>
He who covers<WH3680> an offense<WH6588> promotes<WH1245> love;<WH160> but he who repeats<WH8138> a matter<WH1697> separates<WH6504> best friends.<WH441>
A rebuke<WH1606> enters<WH5181> deeper into one<WH995> who has understanding than a hundred<WH3967> lashes<WH5221> into a fool.<WH3684>
An evil<WH7451> man seeks<WH1245> only rebellion;<WH4805> therefore a cruel<WH394> messenger<WH4397> shall be sent against him.<WH7971>
Let a bear<WH1677> robbed<WH7909> of her cubs meet<WH6298> a man,<WH376> rather than<WH408> a fool<WH3684> in his folly.<WH200>
Whoever rewards<WH7725> evil<WH7451> for good,<WH2896> evil<WH7451> shall not depart<WH4185> from his house.<WH1004>
The beginning<WH7225> of strife<WH4066> is like breaching<WH6362> a dam,<WH4325> therefore stop<WH5203> contention<WH7379> before<WH6440> quarreling breaks out.<WH1566>
He who justifies<WH6663> the wicked,<WH7563> and he who condemns<WH7561> the righteous,<WH6662> both<WH8147> of them alike are an abomination<WH8441> to Yahweh.<WH3068>
Why is there money<WH4242> in the hand<WH3027> of a fool<WH3684> to buy<WH7069> wisdom,<WH2451> since he has no understanding?<WH3820>
A friend<WH7453> loves<WH157> at all times;<WH6256> and a brother<WH251> is born<WH3205> for adversity.<WH6869>
A man<WH120> void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820> strikes<WH8628> hands,<WH3709> and becomes<WH6148> collateral<WH6161> in the presence<WH6440> of his neighbor.<WH7453>
He who loves<WH157> disobedience<WH6588> loves<WH157> strife.<WH4683> One who builds a high<WH1361> gate<WH6607> seeks<WH1245> destruction.<WH7667>
One who has a perverse<WH6141> heart<WH3820> doesn't<WH4672> find prosperity,<WH2896> and one who has a deceitful<WH2015> tongue<WH3956> falls<WH5307> into trouble.<WH7451>
He who becomes the father<WH3205> of a fool<WH3684> grieves.<WH8424> The father<WH1> of a fool<WH5036> has no joy.<WH8055>
A cheerful<WH8056> heart<WH3820> makes good<WH3190> medicine,<WH1456> but a crushed<WH5218> spirit<WH7307> dries<WH3001> up the bones.<WH1634>
A wicked<WH7563> man receives<WH3947> a bribe<WH7810> in secret,<WH2436> to pervert<WH5186> the ways<WH734> of justice.<WH4941>
Wisdom<WH2451> is before the face of one who has understanding,<WH6440> but the eyes<WH5869> of a fool<WH3684> wander to the ends<WH7097> of the earth.<WH776>
A foolish<WH3684> son<WH1121> brings grief<WH3708> to his father,<WH1> and bitterness<WH4470> to her who bore him.<WH3205>
Also to punish<WH6064> the righteous<WH6662> is not good,<WH2896> nor to flog<WH5221> officials<WH5081> for their integrity.<WH3476>
He who spares<WH2820> his words<WH561> has<WH3045> knowledge.<WH1847> He who is even<WH3368> tempered<WH7307> is a man<WH376> of understanding.<WH8394>
Even a fool,<WH191> when he keeps silent,<WH2790> is counted<WH2803> wise.<WH2450> When he shuts<WH331> his lips,<WH8193> he is thought to be discerning.<WH995>
